org.spongepowered.api.block.trait

Interface BlockTrait<T extends Comparable<T>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CatalogType
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BooleanTrait, EnumTrait<E>, IntegerTrait

    public interface BlockTrait<T extends Comparable<T>>
extends CatalogType
    Represents a possible trait in a BlockTypes BlockState.

    A BlockState can include zero or more BlockTraits. Each BlockTrait within a BlockState is mapped to a value which represents the current value at the time the BlockState was taken.

    For example, a BlockTypes.BED contains three possible BlockTraits :

    • EnumTraits.BED_FACING
    • BooleanTraits.BED_OCCUPIED
    • EnumTraits.BED_PART

    If you query a BlockTypes.BED's BlockTrait you have two possible outcomes for each BlockTrait. The BooleanTraits.BED_OCCUPIED has the following possible values :

    • true
    • false

    As 'OCCUPIED' is a BooleanTrait, it can only be true or false. The EnumTraits.BED_PART has the following possible values :

    • HEAD
    • FOOT

    To determine the current value of a BlockTrait, you would call BlockState.getTraitValue(BlockTrait). To determine all possible values of a BlockTrait, you would call BlockType.getTraits().

    As stated above, a BlockType may not always have one or more BlockTraits. An example of such a block is BlockTypes.BOOKSHELF.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this BlockTrait.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface CatalogType
        Returns:
        The trait name

      • getPossibleValues

        Collection<T> getPossibleValues()
        Gets all possible values for a specific BlockTrait. The included values may not be in any particular order. The returned Collection should be considered immutable.
        Returns:
        All possible values

      • getValueClass

        Class<T> getValueClass()
        Gets the class type of the BlockTrait's values.
        Returns:
        The value class

      • getPredicate

        Predicate<T> getPredicate()
        Gets the Predicate used to determine valid values for this. BlockTrait. Any "value" that returns true when Predicate.test(Object) is called is valid. The Predicate is specific to this trait.
        Returns:
        The predicate

      • parseValue

        Optional<T> parseValue(String value)
        Attempts to parse the provided value as a value dictated possible by this trait or Optional.empty() otherwise.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to parse
        Returns:
        The actual value
